intro: Navarretia gilioides, commonly known as the Sierra Lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Navarretia gilioides is often found in open slopes and meadows, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
